channel.title: What's Wrong?

item.title: What's Wrong?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“alancarr123, post:8, topic:269123”]ok i changed it to
public void customCommand(String command) {
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“test”)) {
sendMessage(“Test Command Success.”);
}
}

this is error i got when i tried to compile
client.java:14512: illegal start of expression
public void customCommand(String command) {
^
client.java:14512: illegalstart of expression
public void customCommand(String command) {
^
client.java:14512: ‘;’ expected
public void customCommand(String command) {
^
client.java:14512: ‘;’ expected
public void customCommand(String command) {
^
soz bout being a pain btw [/quote]
make sure it’s outside of any other methods.

Read full topic

item.title: What's Wrong?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“bloodpkrs, post:2, topic:269123”]im almost completly positive that you are missing a “;”
try adding it after

if (! (playerCommand.indexOf("unstuck") > 0)) if (validClient)

and after

if(playerRights > 0)

Hahaha, not every error is a missing ;.

@alancarr123, You’re missing the customCommand:String method.
@noobie22, Nope, you just messed up the code by adding them ; to the if statements.

It should look like this,

      case 103:
        // Custom player command, the ::words
        String playerCommand = inStream.readString();
        if (! (playerCommand.indexOf("unstuck") > 0))
            if (validClient)
                customCommand(playerCommand); 
        break;

But you still need to add the customCommand:String method.

Read full topic

(playerCommand.indexOf("unstuck") > 0)); if (validClient); if(playerRights > 0) customCommand(playerCommand); writeLog(""+playerName+" command: "+playerCommand+"", "commands"); println("command: "+playerCommand+""); break;

item.title: What's Wrong?
item.dc:creator: @alancarr123 alancarr123
item.description:
@alancarr123 wrote:

Ok this is my code

case 103: // Custom player command, the ::words String playerCommand = inStream.readString(); if (! (playerCommand.indexOf("unstuck") > 0)) if (validClient) customCommand(playerCommand); if(playerRights > 0) writeLog(""+playerName+" command: "+playerCommand+"", "commands"); println("command: "+playerCommand+""); break;

this is my compile error
client.java:14516: cannot find symbol
symbol :method customCommand(java.lang.String)
location: class client

^

Please someone help me!
Thanks in advance :D!
